ClientAccumulator.cpp

00001 
00009 // Standard includes
00010 #include <System/Mutex.h>
00011 #include <ServiceControl/ConnectorListener.h>
00012 #include <ServiceControl/Factory.h>
00013 #include <ServiceControl/Service.h>
00014 #include <ServiceControl/ServiceProxy.h>
00015 
00016 #include <iostream>
00017 using namespace std;
00018 
00019 using namespace Omiscid;
00020 
00021 namespace Omiscid {
00022 
00028 class ClientConnectorAndVariableListener : public ConnectorListener, public RemoteVariableChangeListener
00029 {
00030 public:
00031         /* @brief constructor */
00032         ClientConnectorAndVariableListener()
00033         {
00034         }
00035 
00036         /* @brief destructor */
00037         virtual ~ClientConnectorAndVariableListener()
00038         {
00039         }
00040 
00041         /* @brief callback function overide to receive data */
00042         void MessageReceived(Service& TheService, const SimpleString LocalConnectorName, const Message& Msg)
00043         {
00044                 // Create a SimpleString with message and output it
00045                 // even if we can directly output it. Show usage of SimpleString
00046 
00047                 SimpleString Message = Msg.GetBuffer();
00048 
00049                 cerr << Message << endl;
00050         }
00051 
00052         /* @ brief callback for variable changes notification */
00053         void VariableChanged(ServiceProxy& SP, const SimpleString VarName, const SimpleString NewValue )
00054         {
00055                 cout << "Current Accu value: " << NewValue << endl;
00056         };
00057 };
00058 
00059 } // namespace Omiscid
00060 
00061 /* @brief main program entry for the Accumulator. No need to give parameter */
00062 int main(int argc, char*argv[] )
00063 {
00064         // Instanciate a Connector and a Variable listener (must *not* be destroyed before it has
00065         // been removed for the connector or until the service is destroyed).
00066         ClientConnectorAndVariableListener MyListener;
00067 
00068         
00069         // Ask to the service factory to create a Service. The service is not
00070         // register yet. We do not provide the service class, the default value 'Service'
00071         // will be used
00072         Service * pAccuClient = ServiceFactory.Create( "Accumulator Client" );
00073 
00074         // If something tricky occurred, exit
00075         if ( pAccuClient == NULL )
00076         {
00077                 fprintf( stderr, "Could not create the Accumulator Client service.\n" );
00078 
00079                 // Exit the thread
00080                 return -1;
00081         }
00082 
00083         // Add a Connector to send commands and receive error messages (AnInOutput) and set my callback
00084         // object to receive notification of messages
00085         pAccuClient->AddConnector( "SendCommands", "A way to send commands to the Accumulator", AnInOutput );
00086         pAccuClient->AddConnectorListener( "SendCommands", &MyListener );
00087 
00088         // Trace
00089         printf( "Accumulator Client created.\n" );
00090 
00091         // A proxy to communicate with the Accumulator
00092         ServiceProxy * OneAccumulator = NULL;
00093 
00094         // Loop for searching an Accumulator
00095         printf( "Search for an Accumulator service.\n" );
00096         for( int NbTry = 1; NbTry <= 5; NbTry ++ )
00097         {
00098                 // Search for services, wait 5 s (5000 ms) to get an answer
00099                 // Get in return a ServiceProxy*. This service is nammed Accumalator, gets a variable
00100                 // Accu and an InOutput connector "Commands"
00101                 OneAccumulator = pAccuClient->FindService( And(NameIs("Accumulator"),HasVariable("Accu"), HasConnector("Commands",AnInOutput) ), 5000 );
00102 
00103                 if ( OneAccumulator == NULL )
00104                 {
00105                         fprintf( stderr, "Search for an Accumulator service failed. Try again...\n" );
00106                         continue;
00107                 }
00108 
00109                 break;
00110         }
00111 
00112         if ( OneAccumulator == NULL )
00113         {
00114                 fprintf( stderr, "Could not find an Accumulator service. quit !\n" );
00115 
00116                 // delete 
00117                 delete pAccuClient;
00118                 return -1;
00119         }
00120 
00121         // register the Client service and launch everything
00122         // we must do it before communicating with the Accumalator
00123         pAccuClient->Start();
00124 
00125         // Connect to the Accumulator
00126         if ( pAccuClient->ConnectTo( "SendCommands", OneAccumulator, "Commands" ) == true )
00127         {
00128                 // Subscribe to variables changes for Accu. We will receive a first callback
00129                 // when done
00130                 OneAccumulator->AddRemoteVariableChangeListener( "Accu", &MyListener );
00131 
00132                 // Enter command prompt, 1er time with help
00133                 cout << "Enter new command ('+4', '/5.5', ' *8.59', '-6', ' = 8.2'...): " << endl;
00134                 
00135                 // Do my work
00136                 SimpleString LocalCommand;
00137                 for(;;)
00138                 {
00139                         // Get the local command at keyboard
00140                         cin >> LocalCommand;
00141 
00142                         // Send to all connected Client... Here we are connected to only one accumulator
00143                         // we can also use SentToOneClient...
00144                         pAccuClient->SendToAllClients( "SendCommands", (char*)LocalCommand.GetStr(), LocalCommand.GetLength(), false );
00145                 }
00146         }
00147         else
00148         {
00149                 fprintf( stderr, "Could not connect to the Accumulator connector. quit !\n" );
00150         }
00151 
00152         // cleanup everything
00153         delete pAccuClient;
00154         delete OneAccumulator;
00155 
00156         // exit
00157         return 0;
00158 }
